alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of Randolph, central Pocahontas, northeastern Nicholas, southeastern Lewis, eastern Braxton, Upshur, Webster and southern Barbour Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers from Boggs northeast to Buckhannon, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Marlinton, Audra State Park, Webster Springs, Cass Scenic Railroad, Belington, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Snowshoe, Dailey, Birch River, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Mingo, Beverly, Junior, Durbin and Flatwoods. This includes the following highways... Route 19 between mile markers 58 and 66. Route 33 between mile markers 15 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
